instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged laptop off eBay that I'm trying to fix now. Super close to completion but of course I'm stuck somewhere. 
Laptop was sold not booting liquid damaged as is. I have it booting again and when connected to charger it now works perfect however it will not see any battery. Whether it be new or taken from another working laptop it will not see the battery. Orange and green lights are now present on charger.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> has the 8.6v on pins 1,2 and 3.
Pin 4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C6951</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6950</CAPACITOR> don't seem to have <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> and I can't for the life of me figure out why. 
Please advise. Thanks a lot!

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Measure resistance between pins 17 and 18 from <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, also measure voltage on pins 4 and 5 from J6950, report values...

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Thanks mate. I'm in diode mode and when put on pin 17 and 18 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> I get 0.745 (that figure seems wrong so am going back to test again)
Pins 4 and 5 of j6950 both show 3.4v

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Need finer tips for my multimeter I think really having trouble measuring pin 17 and 18 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. I didn't trust my first reading. Haven't been able to recreate it and now it seems there is no resistance at all between pin 17 and 18.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: The battery is not recognized so there is an issue on the data bus to the SMC. Measure diode mode on SCL and SDA lines going to battery connector. There should be voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> if you connect a charged battery.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Siiiiick fixed it duke!! Found a track on sda line that was inconsistent in diode mode. Made a jumper voila!! Happy days! Really appreciate it again!
